There is an issue open for this feature request=
:

Vote up if you agree w=
ith the suggested "runDiscretely" option.

Brett

On Wed, Apr 28, 2010 at 3=
:43 AM, rionard_zhao <prettyrlr@...> wrote:

>
>
> Hi,
> I'm a develope=
r of my company's test framework. Recently, i'm so interested
> in the usag=
e of @DataPoint and @Theory.
>
> I want to use @DataPoint to provide differ=
ent parameters for one @Theory
> test, and i hope my test framework can han=
dle each compatible @DataPoint for
> the @Theory test as the independent te=
st to run. I hope everyone of this
> kind test can generate their own "Asse=
rtion Success" or "Assertion Fail".
>
> For example:
> @DataPoint
> public =
static int testInt =3D 77;
> @DataPoint
> public static String testStr1 =3D=
 new String("Test string 1!");
> @DataPoint
> public static String testStr2=
 =3D new String("Test string 2!");
> @DataPoint
> public static String test=
Str3 =3D new String("Test string 3!");
>
> @Theory
> public void testDataPo=
int(String tempStr){
> System.out.println("Now string is " + tempStr);
> as=
sertEquals("Two strings are not matched!", "Test string 1!", tempStr);
> }
=
>
> I hope "testDataPoint" can run three times with testStr1, testStr2,
> t=
estStr3 in our test framework. But it fails.
>
> It seems that JUnit4(4.4-4=
.8.2) handles the @Theory test as only one test
> no matter how many compat=
ible @DataPoint parameters there are. And it will
> fail the test once an A=
ssertion Fail generate, then, stop here and ignore
> the left @DataPoint pa=
rameters.
>
> Now for one test, we need different parameters to run, we nee=
d assert each
> result, we don't want the test to stop by only one fail res=
ult, we want to
> see all results by one time run.
>
> So, I hope whether y=
ou can change Junit4 internally to satisfy this
> requirement, I think it w=
ill provide more convenience for every tester.
>
> Thank you,
> Rionard Zha=
o
>
>
